Class Planche

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Planche
All Implemented Interfaces:
iPlanche, Serializable
public class Planche extends Object implements iPlanche
The planche class handles the movement of the player on the board. Contains a HashMap that uses player color as a key, and the total steps taken by that player as a value.
See Also:

      public int getPlayerPosition(Player p)
      Returns the current position on the planche of a player.
      Specified by:
      getPlayerPosition in interface iPlanche
      Parameters:
      p - Player The player being searched.
      Returns:
      The position of the player being searched, or -1 if the player is not present.

    • getPlayerAt

      public Player getPlayerAt(int position)
      Given a cell number, finds if there are any players at the corrisponding cell on the board.
      Specified by:
      getPlayerAt in interface iPlanche
      Parameters:
      position - Number of the cell to query.
      Returns:
      Player The player on the cell, or null if nobody occupies it.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(VoyageState state, Player p, int rel_change)
      Either moves the player forward or backwards by a number of steps equal to rel_change, skipping the players in between.
      Specified by:
      movePlayer in interface iPlanche
      Parameters:
      state - VoyageState The state currently being played.
      p - Player The player being moved.
      rel_change - The number of steps the player has to move.
